pullRequest.title: [BEAM-10615] Eliminate nullability errors from :sdks:java:extensions:sql:jdbc
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixing nullability errors from module :sdks:java:extensions:sql:jdbc

Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 Choose reviewer(s) and mention them in a comment (R: @username).
 Format the pull request title like [BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles, where you replace BEAM-XXX with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 Update CHANGES.md with noteworthy changes.
 If this contribution is large, please file an Apache Individual Contributor License Agreement.

See the Contributor Guide for more tips on how to make review process smoother.

nodes.bodyText:
I think actually the appropriate fix here is to make inputStream @Nullable in runSqlLine. It looks like SqlLine handles a null here: https://github.com/julianhyde/sqlline/blob/sqlline-1.4.0/src/main/java/sqlline/SqlLine.java#L717-L722
Could you try that instead?

commit.message: Making the inputstream Nullable for runSqLine

Partial Revert "[BEAM-10615] Eliminate nullability errors from :sdks:java:extensions:sql:jdbc"

This reverts the portions of commit f1070f7104208db165115d6355bdbb59e968d1ac that create new InputStreams.
